value: File:The Black Cock Inn Eaglesfield. - geograph.org.uk - 78448.jpg

Eaglesfield is a small village near
A bus runs most days from the local town of Cockermouth to Cleator Moor, although you will need to check the bus times, as they are very infrequent.

value: The birthplace of John Dalton is in the village and is marked by a small plaque.
The village is also one of a number of villages which may be the birthplace of Fletcher Christian, who led the famous mutiny on the

There is a small pub, "The Black Cock", in the village, and although it does not serve food, it serves a number of local Jennings Ales and light snacks, for example crisps. However this pub is not always open, as the landlady is very old.
Currently there are no lodgings in Eaglesfield.
